column4: you can try formatting the drive you want to store it on with another format that supports larger files than FAT32
not an option i have more than 400gb of data on this hdd and its the only place that has that much data storage i would lose a ton of data
you might have to invest in more storage then
saving for a new computer this one is trash no extra cash
can you maybe borrow another hard drive off a friend or something?
lol Otaku = no friends/life
I don't think that will work, because FAT32 doesn't support files that large :S
also a good point but i have a 6gb movie on my fat32 hdd that got there from downloading it
but linux stops it at 4.0gb
that doesn't even make sense... but it sounds like it might work then :D
llutz and I don't get it either... how you ever managed to get a 6 GB file onto a FAT32 drive is beyond us
i wish i knew
the 6 GB file is a video, right? are you able to watch the entire video OK?
no comp sucks wont play it because its 720p :(
can you play it on the PS3?
no its mkv format
so what exactly was the point of getting the file in the first place? :S
I'd just stick to what my machine could handle lol
so why not
maybe you can help me with 1 other thing
when i plug my headphones to the front port on the computer i lose all sound on my computer but when its pluged in the back i can still hear
and it wont restore audio untill i restart
I have no idea about that one. I have onboard AC`97 and a Creative Labs card, but all my jacks for it are at the rear of my machine
